physical_appearance:The image shows a letter which is light red in colour. All the words in the letters are handwritten
 either in blue or black ink. At the top of the letter
 there is a simple line diagram that starts from one heading and then branches out into four sub-headings. The body of the letter contains fourteen lines and the conclusion in the next paragraph contains two horizontal lines of English words. After the concluding statements
 the letter is signed off. The letter has several brown spots
 most of which are near to its vertical mid-point

subject_terms_3:Letters Kandiar
 Appavoo
sgcool_label_text:A native of Karuvakurichi village
 near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu
 S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying
 handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957
 he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai
 Govindasamy Sarangapany
 Pakkirisami Pillai
 and had friendly associations with them.

metadata.title_text: Life events of Mr.Appavoo Kandiar Letter stating  life events of Mr.Appavoo Kandiar
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a letter which is light red in colour. All the words in the letters are handwritten, either in blue or black ink. At the top of the letter, there is a simple line diagram that starts from one heading and then branches out into four sub-headings. The body of the letter contains fourteen lines and the conclusion in the next paragraph contains two horizontal lines of English words. After the concluding statements, the letter is signed off. The letter has several brown spots, most of which are near to its vertical mid-point
metadata.subject_terms_2: Letters Writing Biography Charts, diagrams, etc.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: A native of Karuvakurichi village, near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu, S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying, handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957, he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai, Govindasamy Sarangapany, Pakkirisami Pillai, and had friendly associations with them.
